snippet: The Calpine Corporation, an independent California power producer, announced two deals yesterday worth a total of $576 million that accelerate its expansion plans. Calpine will add about 40 percent to its portfolio of plants either in operation, u...
lead_paragraph: The Calpine Corporation, an independent California power producer, announced two deals yesterday worth a total of $576 million that accelerate its expansion plans. Calpine will add about 40 percent to its portfolio of plants either in operation, under development or for which development has been announced through the deals. In one deal, Calpine will pay $450 million plus the assumption of certain obligations for SkyGen Energy L.L.C., an Illinois-based company that is 49.9 percent owned by a unit of the Wisconsin Energy Corporation. Calpine also said it would pay Panda Energy International of Dallas $126 million to acquire the rights to develop several power plants. Calpine shares closed up $5.75 to $64.25 on the New York Stock Exchange.
abstract: Calpine Corp, independent California power producer, annoucnes two deals worth total of $576 million that accelerate its expansion plans; Calpine will pay $450 million plus assumption of certain obligations for SkyGen Energy LLC, Illinois-based company that is 49.9 percent owned by unit of Wisconsin Energy Corp; also says it will pay Panda Energy International of Dallas $126 million to acquire rights to develop several power plants (S)

headline.main: CALPINE IN TWO DEALS TO ADD POWER PLANTS
